turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hey, I'm looking for a new game to play. I'm really in the mood for something in the strategy genre, any recommendations?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Okay, I can help with that! Are you thinking real-time strategy (RTS), turn-based strategy (TBS), grand strategy, or something else?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hmm, good question. Probably turn-based, I think. I like having time to think about my moves, you know?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Alright! For turn-based strategy, I would recommend 'Civilization VI'. It's a classic for a reason, with tons of replayability.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Ugh, I've already played Civilization VI to death. Anything a little less... mainstream?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Okay, let's see... How about 'XCOM 2'? It's turn-based with a focus on tactical combat and resource management against an alien invasion. It's known for being quite challenging.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: XCOM 2... I've heard of it. But is it *really* that difficult? I'm not trying to rage-quit every five minutes here.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: It does have a reputation for being challenging, yes. But it also offers a rewarding experience for those who enjoy tactical combat and strategic planning. There are difficulty settings you can adjust to suit your preferences, starting with Rookie and going up from there. Another option might be 'Into the Breach', which offers shorter, puzzle-like tactical scenarios.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: 'Into the Breach' sounds promising. I'll check that out, thanks! You know, why is it so many strategy games are either set in the past or in some sci-fi dystopia? Are there any good, modern-day strategy games out there?
